Package controller

Class PawnController

java.lang.Object
controller.Controller
controller.PawnController
public class PawnController
extends Controller
a type of controller designed to control a Pawn instance. It is a player.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int numbWall  
    private java.lang.String playerName

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void move​(Coord direction)
    Will move the controller's pawn into the given direction.
    void placeWall​(Coord origin, Coord direction)
    given an coordinate (origin) and a direction (UP or RIGHT), place a wall and register it in the board.

  • Field Details

    • playerName

      private java.lang.String playerName

    • numbWall

      private int numbWall

  • Constructor Details

    • PawnController

      public PawnController​(boolean AI, Pawn dependency, Board board, java.lang.String playerName, int numbWall)
      Parameters:
      AI - true : controlled by an AI, false for a human.
      dependency - refers to the items the controller is controlling.
      board - the board in which the controller is evolving.
      playerName - the name of the player.
      numbWall - the number of wall of the player. Default is 10.

    • PawnController

      public PawnController​(boolean AI, Pawn dependency, Board board, java.lang.String playerName)
      Parameters:
      AI - true : controlled by an AI, false for a human.
      dependency - refers to the items the controller is controlling.
      board - the board in which the controller is evolving.
      playerName - the name of the player.

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move​(Coord direction)
      Will move the controller's pawn into the given direction. Does not care if there is a wall or not. It does it. This kind of verification must be called before calling this method.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction the controller is moving

    • placeWall

      public void placeWall​(Coord origin, Coord direction) throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
      given an coordinate (origin) and a direction (UP or RIGHT), place a wall and register it in the board.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin of the wall
      direction - the direction of the wall used to create it's second part (UP or RIGHT)
      Throws:
      java.security.InvalidParameterException - is thrown if the direction is invalid (not UP or RIGHT)
